entry.title: Learning Architecture Design from K8s
entry.summary: We must be careful not to fall into a reactive mode where we feel compelled to immediately eliminate any duplication we encounter. It‚Äôs essential to ensure that our actions to remove duplication are only targeted at what is truly duplicate in a meaningful sense. If there are two pieces of code that look similar but follow different evolutionary paths‚Äîmeaning they have different rates of change and different reasons for change‚Äîthen they are not truly duplicate code. Having code today that doesn‚Äôt hinder future code is a highly important skill, and it often takes years to master. This is because real trouble usually doesn‚Äôt arise while running the software, but rather during the development, deployment, and subsequent maintenance of the software system. Many people, especially in the beginni‚Ä¶

entry.title: Stop Overpaying: 3 Cheaper Alternatives to DigitalOcean VPS
entry.summary:
If you're like me, you've probably started a few side projects or small apps and quickly realized that even "affordable" platforms like DigitalOcean can add up fast. In this post, I'll share some cheaper (and sometimes free) alternatives to host your projects without burning your wallet. Let's dive in! Cloudfnatic (my personal choice)
Price: Starts at $2.99/month
Hetzner Cloud
Price: Starts at ‚Ç¨3.79/month
Oracle Cloud Free Tier
Price: Free forever
These are just a few of the most affordable VPS options I‚Äôve found while trying to cut costs without sacrificing flexibility. If you know any other hidden gems or have experience with the ones listed here, drop a comment below ‚Äî I'd love to hear your thoughts, tips, or even horror stories. Let's help each other host smarter! üöÄ

entry.title: How to Install Qwen3 Embedding 8B: Best Model for RAG, Search, & Multilingual Embeddings
entry.summary: If you're searching for state-of-the-art models for text retrieval, classification, clustering, or multilingual semantic search, Alibaba's Qwen3 has just launched the powerful series of Embedding models in this segment. Qwen3 Embedding 8B, the largest and most powerful member of the Qwen3 Embedding family, is a model you can't afford to ignore. This 8-billion-parameter model delivers unmatched performance in generating dense, high-quality text embeddings across over 100 languages, including programming languages. With a context window of 32k tokens and flexible embedding dimensions (up to 4096), Qwen3 Embedding 8B is not only highly scalable but also deeply adaptable to a wide range of NLP tasks. It currently ranks #1 on the MTEB multilingual leaderboard (as of June 5, 2025), setting a new‚Ä¶

entry.title: MCP OAuth on AWS Lambda with WorkOS
entry.summary:
Photo by Bruno Alves on Unsplash I plan to implement an MCP server secured with OAuth. I will use a third-party identity provider (WorkOS for this blog post, but general rules would be the same for other services). The created resource is meant to be used by users in their MCP clients. The main idea is to build a serverless solution that might integrate with the existing authentication flow. From the user's perspective, using MCP Server should feel similar to using other services. The current MCP specification assumes that the MCP Server will handle authorization as well. It might work if you have a single MCP server, but it doesn't fit well into an enterprise landscape, with dozens of services and a separate layer for identity provider.
I will create two separate services behind the A‚Ä¶

entry.title: How to Install and Run Xiaomi MiMo-VL Locally
entry.summary: We are living in times when vision-language models (VLMs) are rapidly evolving with each of them having their own pros and cons and uniqueness to stand out. MiMo-VL-7B, recently launched by Xiaomi, is now trending on Hugging Face and stands out as a compact yet remarkably capable model that pushes the boundaries of multi-modal reasoning. At just 7B parameters, MiMo-VL-7B integrates a native-resolution ViT encoder that captures fine-grained visual detail, an efficient MLP projector for cross-modal alignment, and the MiMo-7B language model optimized specifically for complex reasoning. Its development spans a rigorous two-phase training pipeline: a four-stage pretraining phase that results in the SFT variant, and a post-training phase introducing Mixed On-policy Reinforcement Learning (MORL),‚Ä¶

entry.title: I Just Released My Personal Password Manager App ‚Äî CyberSafe
entry.summary: Hello everyone! I‚Äôm excited to share that CyberSafe ‚Äî a fully offline password manager app I developed personally ‚Äî has just been published on Google Play! This project has been a labor of love for me. I wanted to build a secure app that allows users to safely store passwords and sensitive information completely offline with strong AES-256 encryption. CyberSafe requires no account, no cloud sync, and fully respects user privacy. The app features a clean and intuitive interface optimized for both phones and tablets. Some key features include: Manage passwords, notes, and 2FA (TOTP) codes Powerful password generator and smart security check Secure backup and restore stored locally on your device No ads, no tracking, no data collection I would be grateful for your support, feedback, and congratulations as I continue to improve and grow CyberSafe. Thank you all for following along and being part of this journey! CyberSafe - Google Play

entry.title: How to Monitor Network Traffic on Linux
entry.summary:
Directly starting with the topic iftop ‚Äî Real-time Bandwidth Monitoring Per Connection
Use Case: View which remote hosts are consuming bandwidth in real-time. Install: sudo apt install iftop
Usage: sudo iftop -i eth0 # Replace eth0 with your network interface
Key Features: Shows top connections by bandwidth Inbound/outbound traffic Tips: Press t to toggle display modes Press p to pause Combine with -B for display in bytes nload ‚Äî Simple Interface Bandwidth
Use Case: Monitor incoming/outgoing traffic per interface. Install: sudo apt install nload
Usage: sudo nload eth0
Key Features: Graphical view of upload/download rate Totals and current stats bmon ‚Äî Bandwidth Monitoring and Visualization
Use Case: Visual tool to monitor all interfaces and track traffic. Install: sudo ap‚Ä¶

entry.title: Versioned web components and micro front-ends
entry.summary:
Introduction
Imagine the following scenario: You‚Äôre working with a micro-frontend (MFE) architecture where each MFE is an independent application relying on a shared UI library of web components. Sounds great, right? But here‚Äôs the catch: The UI library is versioned. Different MFEs might depend on different versions of the library. Upgrading all MFEs to the latest version simultaneously is a logistical nightmare. Why is this a problem? Well, web components use the global namespace for their custom elements. This means you can‚Äôt define two versions of the same element (e.g., v1 and v2 of the same component) with the same name in the same document. Thankfully, some brilliant minds have already thought about this problem. Enter the concept of Scoped Custom Element Registries. Back in 2020, ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Angular Silently Released AI Guidelines
entry.summary: The new guidelines show how you can use Google AI services in your Angular app without trouble, protecting your APIs and doing multimodal queries with ease Just lately it was extended with two pages dedicated to building Angular apps with AI. First is ‚ÄúGet Started‚Äù, and second ‚ÄúUsing AI for Development‚Äù. Hi, My name is Tom Smykowski, I‚Äôm a professional core frontend engineer building scalable MVP frontends and helping creators and teams embrace vibe coding The first one shows how you can use AI in Angular apps. There is a guide using Genkit, Firebase AI Logic and Gemini API in your apps. If you don‚Äôt know already, Genkit is a Firebase open source library to create full stack apps based on AI, so it‚Äôs created by Google. You can easily connect to Gemini, Imagen, OpenAI, Anthropic, Llama, Mistral and Ollama and other with this library. A vibe coding t-shirt In the guide you‚Äôll find examples of simple apps built with AI that showcase how it can be used for practical B2B and B2C applications. The second guide ‚ÄúUsing AI for development‚Äù is doing what I mentioned in previous post. It provides LLM guidelines for your favorite model. That page is quite short. But really what to write more other than providing guidelines for the model. It‚Äôs all vibe coders really need.

entry.title: DeadLock - JSON Parsing #3
entry.summary: Hello everyone! I am excited to announce that I have successfully completed the JSON parsing for deadlock. Provided that the libraries follow the same API response standards and file management. Speaking of file management, I got to know and understand the whl extension which is just a simple zip archive that can be installed in site-packages folder of python installation. All this I'll have to configure in the deadlock while figuring out a way to create a whole new virtual environment. Right now I am thinking of creating a virtual environment feature as more of a secondary feature. I think I can get away with running just python -m venv .venv command in the user's terminal. But then I think why did I came all this ay configuring cURL, parsing JSON and then extract the packages when I can just run pip install in the terminal too. Let me know what you think by commenting below üëá Till then bye, bye ü´°
